Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:jquery:\>\=1.1.4\<3.4.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-rmxg-73gg-4p98 (NPM)  

Affected versions of `jquery` interpret `text/javascript` responses from cross-origin ajax requests, and automatically execute the contents in `jQuery.globalEval`, even when the ajax request doesn't contain the `dataType` option.


## Recommendation

Update to version 3.0.0 or later.
CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.099999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00041.html
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/152787/dotCMS-5.1.1-Vulnerable-Dependencies.html
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153237/RetireJS-CORS-Issue-Script-Execution.html
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/156743/OctoberCMS-Insecure-Dependencies.html

jszip:3.2.2

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?jszip

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamejszipHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamejszipHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion3.2.2Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/jszip@3.2.2  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-48285 (OSSINDEX)  

jszip - Arbitrary File Write via Archive Extraction (Zip Slip)

The software uses external input to construct a pathname that should be within a restricted directory, but it does not properly neutralize '..filename' (leading backslash dot dot) sequences that can resolve to a location that is outside of that directory.
CWE-29 Path Traversal: '\..\filename'

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (8.199999809265137)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:H/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-48285] CWE-29: Path Traversal: '..filename'
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/Stuk/jszip/pull/813
  • OSSIndex - https://stuk.github.io/jszip/CHANGES.html

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:jszip:3.2.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

loadAsync in JSZip before 3.8.0 allows Directory Traversal via a crafted ZIP archive.
CWE-22 Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:jszip:\<3.8.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

CVE-2021-23413 (OSSINDEX)  

This affects the package jszip before 3.7.0. Crafting a new zip file with filenames set to Object prototype values (e.g __proto__, toString, etc) results in a returned object with a modified prototype instance.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2021-23413 for details
CWE-noinfo

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2021-23413] CWE-noinfo
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2021-23413
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/Stuk/jszip/issues/762
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/Stuk/jszip/pull/766

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:jszip:3.2.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

This affects the package jszip before 3.7.0. Crafting a new zip file with filenames set to Object prototype values (e.g `__proto__`, `toString`, etc) results in a returned object with a modified prototype instance.

kerberos:0.0.24

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?kerberos

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamekerberosHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamekerberosHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion0.0.24Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/kerberos@0.0.24  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-m2mx-rfpw-jghv (NPM)  

Version of `kerberos` prior to 1.0.0 are vulnerable to DLL Injection. The package loads DLLs without specifying a full path. This may allow attackers to create a file with the same name in a folder that precedes the intended file in the DLL path search. Doing so would allow attackers to execute arbitrary code in the machine.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to version 1.0.0 or later.
CWE-427 Uncontrolled Search Path Element

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m2mx-rfpw-jghv
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://medium.com/@kiddo_Ha3ker/dll-injection-attack-in-kerberos-npm-package-cb4b32031cd
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13110
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.linkedin.com/posts/op-innovate_dll-injection-attack-in-kerberos-npm-package-activity-6667043749547253760-kVlW
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/1514
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.op-c.net/2020/05/15/dll-injection-attack-in-kerberos-npm-package/

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:kerberos:\<1.0.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

Productpackage.jsonnamekind-ofHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion6.0.2Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/kind-of@6.0.2  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2019-20149 (OSSINDEX)  

ctorName in index.js in kind-of v6.0.2 allows external user input to overwrite certain internal attributes via a conflicting name, as demonstrated by 'constructor': {'name':'Symbol'}. Hence, a crafted payload can overwrite this builtin attribute to manipulate the type detection result.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2019-20149 for details
CWE-668 Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2019-20149] CWE-668: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2019-20149
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/jonschlinkert/kind-of/issues/30
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/jonschlinkert/kind-of/pull/31

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:kind-of:6.0.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-6c8f-qphg-qjgp (NPM)  

Versions of `kind-of` 6.x prior to 6.0.3 are vulnerable to a Validation Bypass. A maliciously crafted object can alter the result of the type check, allowing attackers to bypass the type checking validation. 


## Recommendation

Upgrade to versions 6.0.3 or later.
CWE-668 Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N

lodash.set:4.3.2

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?lodash.set

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamelodash.setHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamelodash.setHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion4.3.2Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/lodash.set@4.3.2  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-p6mc-m468-83gw (NPM)  

Versions of lodash prior to 4.17.19 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The functions `pick`, `set`, `setWith`, `update`, `updateWith`, and `zipObjectDeep` allow a malicious user to modify the prototype of Object if the property identifiers are user-supplied. Being affected by this issue requires manipulating objects based on user-provided property values or arrays.

This vulnerability causes the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects and may lead to Denial of Service or Code Execution under specific circumstances.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution'), CWE-770 Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.400000095367432)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p6mc-m468-83gw
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/github/advisory-database/pull/2884
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c84fe82760fb2d3e03a63379b297a1cc1a2fce12
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/4744
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/4874
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/wiki/Changelog#v41719
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://hackerone.com/reports/712065
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://hackerone.com/reports/864701
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8203
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200724-0006/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://web.archive.org/web/20210914001339/https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/4744

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:lodash.set:\>\=3.7.0\<\=4.3.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-jf85-cpcp-j695 (NPM)  

Versions of `lodash` before 4.17.12 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution.  The function `defaultsDeep` allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of `Object` via `{constructor: {prototype: {...}}}` causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.

## Recommendation

Update to version 4.17.12 or later.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution'), CWE-20 Improper Input Validation

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.100000381469727)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: critical

CVE-2020-8203 (OSSINDEX)  

lodash - Prototype Pollution [ CVE-2020-8203 ] 

The software does not properly protect an assumed-immutable element from being modified by an attacker.

GHSA-4xc9-xhrj-v574 (NPM)  

Versions of `lodash` before 4.17.11 are vulnerable to prototype pollution. 

The vulnerable functions are 'defaultsDeep', 'merge', and 'mergeWith' which allow a malicious user to modify the prototype of `Object` via `{constructor: {prototype: {...}}}` causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.




## Recommendation

Update to version 4.17.11 or later.
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4xc9-xhrj-v574

CVE-2018-3721 (OSSINDEX)  

lodash node module before 4.17.5 suffers from a Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data (MAID) vulnerability via defaultsDeep, merge, and mergeWith functions, which allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of "Object" via __proto__, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.

CVE-2020-28500 (OSSINDEX)  

Lodash versions prior to 4.17.21 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the toNumber, trim and trimEnd functions.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2020-28500 for details
CWE-Other

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2020-28500] CWE-Other
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2020-28500
  • OSSIndex - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1928954
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/pull/5065

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:lodash:4.17.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-29mw-wpgm-hmr9 (NPM)  

All versions of package lodash prior to 4.17.21 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the `toNumber`, `trim` and `trimEnd` functions. 

Steps to reproduce (provided by reporter Liyuan Chen):
```js
var lo = require('lodash');

function build_blank(n) {
    var ret = "1"
    for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        ret += " "
    }
    return ret + "1";
}
var s = build_blank(50000) var time0 = Date.now();
lo.trim(s) 
var time_cost0 = Date.now() - time0;
console.log("time_cost0: " + time_cost0);
var time1 = Date.now();
lo.toNumber(s) var time_cost1 = Date.now() - time1;
console.log("time_cost1: " + time_cost1);
var time2 = Date.now();
lo.trimEnd(s);
var time_cost2 = Date.now() - time2;
console.log("time_cost2: " + time_cost2);
```
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption, CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-637483.pdf
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-29mw-wpgm-hmr9
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/npm/trimEnd.js%23L8
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c4847ebe7d14540bb28a8b932a9ce1b9ecbfee1a
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/pull/5065
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/lodash/lodash/pull/5065/commits/02906b8191d3c100c193fe6f7b27d1c40f200bb7
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-28500
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210312-0006/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGFUJIONWEBJARS-1074896
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARS-1074894
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSBOWER-1074892
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSBOWERGITHUBLODASH-1074895
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSNPM-1074893
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-LODASH-1018905
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.oracle.com//security-alerts/cpujul2021.html
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujul2022.html
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:lodash:\<4.17.21:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-x5rq-j2xg-h7qm (NPM)

The attack vector is: Attacker provides very long strings, which the library attempts to match using a regular expression. The fixed version is: 4.7.11.

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2018-25110 (OSSINDEX)  

marked - Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via Catastrophic Backtracking [CVE-2018-25110]

The software does not properly restrict the size or amount of resources that are requested or influenced by an actor, which can be used to consume more resources than intended.
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/1058

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:marked:0.3.5:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-5v2h-r2cx-5xgj (NPM)  

### Impact

_What kind of vulnerability is it?_

Denial of service.

The regular expression `inline.reflinkSearch` may cause catastrophic backtracking against some strings.
PoC is the following.

```javascript
import * as marked from 'marked';

console.log(marked.parse(`[x]: x

\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](\\[\\](`));
```

_Who is impacted?_

Anyone who runs untrusted markdown through marked and does not use a worker with a time limit.

### Patches

_Has the problem been patched?_

Yes

_What versions should users upgrade to?_

4.0.10

### Workarounds

_Is there a way for users to fix or remediate the vulnerability without upgrading?_

Do not run untrusted markdown through marked or run marked on a [worker](https://marked.js.org/using_advanced#workers) thread and set a reasonable time limit to prevent draining resources.

### References

_Are there any links users can visit to find out more?_

- https://marked.js.org/using_advanced#workers
- https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS

### For more information

If you have any questions or comments about this advisory:

* Open an issue in [marked](https://github.com/markedjs/marked)
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5v2h-r2cx-5xgj
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/8f806573a3f6c6b7a39b8cdb66ab5ebb8d55a5f5
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/c4a3ccd344b6929afa8a1d50ac54a721e57012c0
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/markedjs/marked/security/advisories/GHSA-5v2h-r2cx-5xgj
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/AIXDMC3CSHYW3YWVSQOXAWLUYQHAO5UX/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-21681

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:marked:\<4.0.10:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-rrrm-qjm4-v8hf (NPM)  

### Impact

_What kind of vulnerability is it?_

Denial of service.

The regular expression `block.def` may cause catastrophic backtracking against some strings.
PoC is the following.

```javascript
import * as marked from "marked";

marked.parse(`[x]:${' '.repeat(1500)}x ${' '.repeat(1500)} x`);
```

_Who is impacted?_

Anyone who runs untrusted markdown through marked and does not use a worker with a time limit.

### Patches

_Has the problem been patched?_

Yes

_What versions should users upgrade to?_

4.0.10

### Workarounds

_Is there a way for users to fix or remediate the vulnerability without upgrading?_

Do not run untrusted markdown through marked or run marked on a [worker](https://marked.js.org/using_advanced#workers) thread and set a reasonable time limit to prevent draining resources.

### References

_Are there any links users can visit to find out more?_

- https://marked.js.org/using_advanced#workers
- https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS

### For more information

If you have any questions or comments about this advisory:

* Open an issue in [marked](https://github.com/markedjs/marked)
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption, CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rrrm-qjm4-v8hf
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/c4a3ccd344b6929afa8a1d50ac54a721e57012c0

GHSA-x5pg-88wf-qq4p (NPM)  

Affected versions of `marked` are vulnerable to a regular expression denial of service. 

The amplification in this vulnerability is significant, with 1,000 characters resulting in the event loop being blocked for around 6 seconds.


## Recommendation

Update to version 0.3.9 or later.

GHSA-vfvf-mqq8-rwqc (NPM)  

Affected versions of `marked` are susceptible to a cross-site scripting vulnerability in link components when `sanitize:true` is configured. 

## Proof of Concept

This flaw exists because link URIs containing HTML entities get processed in an abnormal manner. Any HTML Entities get parsed on a best-effort basis and included in the resulting link, while if that parsing fails that character is omitted.

For example:

A link URI such as
```
javascript&#x58document;alert&#40;1&#41;
```
Renders a valid link that when clicked will execute `alert(1)`.


## Recommendation

Update to version 0.3.6 or later.
CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.099999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vfvf-mqq8-rwqc
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/chjj/marked/pull/592
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/chjj/marked/pull/592/commits/2cff85979be8e7a026a9aca35542c470cf5da523
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-10531
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/101

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:marked:\<0.3.6:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-p9wx-2529-fp83 (NPM)  

Marked prior to version 0.3.17 is vulnerable to a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attack due to catastrophic backtracking in several regular expressions used for parsing HTML tags and markdown links. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by providing specially crafted markdown input, such as deeply nested or repetitively structured brackets or tag attributes, which cause the parser to hang and lead to a Denial of Service.
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/Checkmarx/Vulnerabilities-Proofs-of-Concept/tree/main/2018/CVE-2018-25110

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-4xcv-9jjx-gfj3 (NPM)  

Versions of `mem` prior to 4.0.0 are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS).  The package fails to remove old values from the cache even after a value passes its `maxAge` property. This may allow attackers to exhaust the system's memory if they are able to abuse the application logging.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to version 4.0.0 or later.
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.099999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N

  • Severity: moderate

micromatch:3.1.10

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?micromatch

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamemicromatchHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamemicromatchHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion3.1.10Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/micromatch@3.1.10  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2024-4067 (OSSINDEX)  

The NPM package `micromatch` prior to 4.0.8 is vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS). The vulnerability occurs in `micromatch.braces()` in `index.js` because the pattern `.*` will greedily match anything. By passing a malicious payload, the pattern matching will keep backtracking to the input while it doesn't find the closing bracket. As the input size increases, the consumption time will also increase until it causes the application to hang or slow down. There was a merged fix but further testing shows the issue persists. This issue should be mitigated by using a safe pattern that won't start backtracking the regular expression due to greedy matching. This issue was fixed in version 4.0.8.
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2024-4067] CWE-1333
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2024-4067
  • OSSIndex - https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-4067

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:micromatch:3.1.10:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-952p-6rrq-rcjv (NPM)  

The NPM package `micromatch` prior to version 4.0.8 is vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS). The vulnerability occurs in `micromatch.braces()` in `index.js` because the pattern `.*` will greedily match anything. By passing a malicious payload, the pattern matching will keep backtracking to the input while it doesn't find the closing bracket. As the input size increases, the consumption time will also increase until it causes the application to hang or slow down. There was a merged fix but further testing shows the issue persisted prior to https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch/pull/266. This issue should be mitigated by using a safe pattern that won't start backtracking the regular expression due to greedy matching.
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://advisory.checkmarx.net/advisory/CVE-2024-4067
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://devhub.checkmarx.com/cve-details/CVE-2024-4067
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-952p-6rrq-rcjv
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch/blob/2c56a8604b68c1099e7bc0f807ce0865a339747a/index.js#L448
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch/commit/03aa8052171e878897eee5d7bb2ae0ae83ec2ade
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch/commit/500d5d6f42f0e8dfa1cb5464c6cb420b1b6aaaa0
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch/issues/243
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch/pull/247
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch/pull/266
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch/releases/tag/4.0.8
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-4067

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:micromatch:\<4.0.8:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-3517

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:minimatch:\<3.0.5:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

CVE-2020-7598 (OSSINDEX)  

minimist before 1.2.2 could be tricked into adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using a "constructor" or "__proto__" payload.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2020-7598 for details
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.599999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2020-7598] CWE-1321
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2020-7598
  • OSSIndex - https://gist.github.com/Kirill89/47feb345b09bf081317f08dd43403a8a

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:minimist:0.0.10:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-vh95-rmgr-6w4m (NPM)  

Affected versions of `minimist` are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of `Object`, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.  
Parsing the argument `--__proto__.y=Polluted` adds a `y` property with value `Polluted` to all objects. The argument `--__proto__=Polluted` raises and uncaught error and crashes the application.  
This is exploitable if attackers have control over the arguments being passed to `minimist`.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to versions 0.2.1, 1.2.3 or later.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.599999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-06/msg00024.html
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vh95-rmgr-6w4m
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/minimistjs/minimist/commit/10bd4cdf49d9686d48214be9d579a9cdfda37c68
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/minimistjs/minimist/commit/38a4d1caead72ef99e824bb420a2528eec03d9ab
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/minimistjs/minimist/commit/4cf1354839cb972e38496d35e12f806eea92c11f#diff-a1e0ee62c91705696ddb71aa30ad4f95
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/minimistjs/minimist/commit/63e7ed05aa4b1889ec2f3b196426db4500cbda94
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-7598
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-MINIMIST-559764
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/1179

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:minimist:\<0.2.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

Affected versions of `minimist` are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of `Object`, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.  
Parsing the argument `--__proto__.y=Polluted` adds a `y` property with value `Polluted` to all objects. The argument `--__proto__=Polluted` raises and uncaught error and crashes the application.

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2019-10746 (OSSINDEX)  

mixin-deep is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution in versions before 1.3.2 and version 2.0.0. The function mixin-deep could be tricked into adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using a constructor payload.
CWE-88 Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:mixin-deep:1.3.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-fhjf-83wg-r2j9 (NPM)  

Versions of `mixin-deep` prior to 2.0.1 or 1.3.2 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The `mixinDeep` function fails to validate which Object properties it updates. This allows attackers to modify the prototype of Object, causing the addition or modification of an existing property on all objects.


## Recommendation

If you are using `mixin-deep` 2.x, upgrade to version 2.0.1 or later.
If you are using `mixin-deep` 1.x, upgrade to version 1.3.2 or later.
CWE-88 Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: critical

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fhjf-83wg-r2j9

Published Vulnerabilities

moment - Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS)

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:moment:2.15.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

CVE-2022-24785 (OSSINDEX)  

Moment.js is a JavaScript date library for parsing, validating, manipulating, and formatting dates. A path traversal vulnerability impacts npm (server) users of Moment.js between versions 1.0.1 and 2.29.1, especially if a user-provided locale string is directly used to switch moment locale. This problem is patched in 2.29.2, and the patch can be applied to all affected versions. As a workaround, sanitize the user-provided locale name before passing it to Moment.js.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2022-24785 for details
CWE-22 Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-24785] CWE-22: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-24785
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/moment/moment/security/advisories/GHSA-8hfj-j24r-96c4

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:moment:2.15.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-446m-mv8f-q348 (NPM)  

Affected versions of `moment` are vulnerable to a low severity regular expression denial of service when parsing dates as strings.


## Recommendation

Update to version 2.19.3 or later.
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

  • Severity: high

  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/moment/moment/issues/4163

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:moment:\<2.19.3:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-8hfj-j24r-96c4 (NPM)  

### Impact
This vulnerability impacts npm (server) users of moment.js, especially if user provided locale string, eg `fr` is directly used to switch moment locale.

### Patches
This problem is patched in 2.29.2, and the patch can be applied to all affected versions (from 1.0.1 up until 2.29.1, inclusive).

### Workarounds
Sanitize user-provided locale name before passing it to moment.js.

### References
_Are there any links users can visit to find out more?_

### For more information
If you have any questions or comments about this advisory:
* Open an issue in [moment repo](https://github.com/moment/moment)
CWE-22 Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal'), CWE-27 Path Traversal: 'dir/../../filename'

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8hfj-j24r-96c4
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/moment/moment/commit/4211bfc8f15746be4019bba557e29a7ba83d54c5
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/moment/moment/security/advisories/GHSA-8hfj-j24r-96c4
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/01/msg00035.html
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6QIO6YNLTK2T7SPKDS4JEL45FANLNC2Q/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ORJX2LF6KMPIHP6B2P6KZIVKMLE3LVJ5/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-24785
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220513-0006/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2022-09

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:moment:\<2.29.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

mongodb:2.0.46

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?mongodb

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamemongodbHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamemongodbHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion2.0.46Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/mongodb@2.0.46  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2021-32050 (OSSINDEX)  

Some MongoDB Drivers may erroneously publish events containing authentication-related data to a command listener configured by an application. The published events may contain security-sensitive data when specific authentication-related commands are executed.

Without due care, an application may inadvertently expose this sensitive information, e.g., by writing it to a log file. This issue only arises if an application enables the command listener feature (this is not enabled by default).

This issue affects the MongoDB C Driver 1.0.0 prior to 1.17.7, MongoDB PHP Driver 1.0.0 prior to 1.9.2, MongoDB Swift Driver 1.0.0 prior to 1.1.1, MongoDB Node.js Driver 3.6 prior to 3.6.10, MongoDB Node.js Driver 4.0 prior to 4.17.0 and MongoDB Node.js Driver 5.0 prior to 5.8.0. This issue also affects users of the MongoDB C++ Driver dependent on the C driver 1.0.0 prior to 1.17.7 (C++ driver prior to 3.7.0).

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2021-32050 for details
CWE-200 Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2021-32050] CWE-200: Information Exposure
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2021-32050
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vxvm-qww3-2fh7

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:mongodb:2.0.46:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-mh5c-679w-hh4r (NPM)  

Versions of `mongodb` prior to 3.1.13 are vulnerable to Denial of Service. The package fails to properly catch an exception when a collection name is invalid and the DB does not exist, crashing the application.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to version 3.1.13 or later.
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mh5c-679w-hh4r
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/1203

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:mongoose:4.2.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-h8hf-x3f4-xwgp (NPM)  

### Description
Mongoose is a MongoDB object modeling tool designed to work in an asynchronous environment.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The `Schema.path()` function is vulnerable to prototype pollution when setting the `schema` object. This vulnerability allows modification of the Object prototype and could be manipulated into a Denial of Service (DoS) attack.

### Proof of Concept
```js
// poc.js
const mongoose = require('mongoose');
const schema = new mongoose.Schema();

malicious_payload = '__proto__.toString'

schema.path(malicious_payload, [String])

x = {}
console.log(x.toString()) // crashed (Denial of service (DoS) attack)
```

### Impact
This vulnerability can be manipulated to exploit other types of attacks, such as Denial of service (DoS), Remote Code Execution, or Property Injection.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: critical

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose/blob/51e758541763b6f14569744ced15cc23ab8b50c6/lib/schema.js#L88-L141
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose/commit/6a197316564742c0422309e1b5fecfa4faec126e
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose/commit/a45cfb6b0ce0067ae9794cfa80f7917e1fb3c6f8
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/12085
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h8hf-x3f4-xwgp
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://huntr.dev/bounties/055be524-9296-4b2f-b68d-6d5b810d1ddd/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-24304

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:mongoose:\<5.13.15:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-m7xq-9374-9rvx (NPM)  

Mongoose versions prior to 8.8.3, 7.8.3, and 6.13.5 are vulnerable to improper use of the $where operator. This vulnerability arises from the ability of the $where clause to execute arbitrary JavaScript code in MongoDB queries, potentially leading to code injection attacks and unauthorized access or manipulation of database data.
CWE-89 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

CVE-2019-17426 (OSSINDEX)  

Automattic Mongoose through 5.7.4 allows attackers to bypass access control (in some applications) because any query object with a _bsontype attribute is ignored. For example, adding "_bsontype":"a" can sometimes interfere with a query filter. NOTE: this CVE is about Mongoose's failure to work around this _bsontype special case that exists in older versions of the bson parser (aka the mongodb/js-bson project).
CWE-noinfo

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.100000381469727)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2019-17426] CWE-noinfo
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2019-17426
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/8222

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:mongoose:4.2.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-8687-vv9j-hgph (NPM)  

Automattic Mongoose through 5.7.4 allows attackers to bypass access control (in some applications) because any query object with a `_bsontype` attribute is ignored. For example, adding `"_bsontype":"a"` can sometimes interfere with a query filter. NOTE: this CVE is about Mongoose's failure to work around this _bsontype special case that exists in older versions of the bson parser (aka the mongodb/js-bson project).
CWE-20 Improper Input Validation

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.100000381469727)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: critical

References:

  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose/commits/4.13.21

GHSA-vg7j-7cwx-8wgw (NPM)  

Mongoose versions prior to 8.9.5, 7.8.4, and 6.13.6 are vulnerable to improper use of the `$where` operator. This vulnerability arises from the ability of the `$where` clause to execute arbitrary JavaScript code in MongoDB queries, potentially leading to code injection attacks and unauthorized access or manipulation of database data.

NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2024-53900.
CWE-94 Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.100000381469727)

GHSA-r5xw-q988-826m (NPM)  

Versions of `mongoose` before 4.3.6, 3.8.39 are vulnerable to remote memory exposure.

Trying to save a number to a field of type Buffer on the affected mongoose versions allocates a chunk of uninitialized memory and stores it in the database.


## Recommendation

Update to version 4.3.6, 3.8.39 or later.
CWE-201 Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.099999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://gist.github.com/ChALkeR/440bc3dfcbd9b6da75c3
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://gist.github.com/ChALkeR/d4a8055625221b6e65f0
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/Automattic/mongoose/issues/3764
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r5xw-q988-826m
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/599

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-h466-j336-74wx (NPM)  

Versions of `mpath` before 0.5.1 are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Provided certain input `mpath` can add or modify properties of the `Object` prototype. These properties will be present on all objects.


## Recommendation

Update to version `0.5.1` or later.
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption, CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:mpath:\<0.5.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-p92x-r36w-9395 (NPM)  

This affects the package mpath before 0.8.4. A type confusion vulnerability can lead to a bypass of CVE-2018-16490. In particular, the condition `ignoreProperties.indexOf(parts[i]) !== -1` returns `-1` if `parts[i]` is `['__proto__']`. This is because the method that has been called if the input is an array is `Array.prototype.indexOf()` and not `String.prototype.indexOf()`. They behave differently depending on the type of the input.
CWE-843 Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.599999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p92x-r36w-9395
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/aheckmann/mpath/commit/89402d2880d4ea3518480a8c9847c541f2d824fc
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/mongoosejs/mpath/commit/89402d2880d4ea3518480a8c9847c541f2d824fc
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-23438
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSNPM-1579548
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-MPATH-1577289

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:mpath:\<0.8.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/aheckmann/mquery/commit/792e69fd0a7281a0300be5cade5a6d7c1d468ad4
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-35149

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:mquery:\<3.2.3:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

ms:0.6.2

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?ms

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamemsHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamemsHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion0.6.2Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/ms@0.6.2  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-3fx5-fwvr-xrjg (NPM)  

Versions of `ms` prior to 0.7.1 are affected by a regular expression denial of service vulnerability when extremely long version strings are parsed.

## Proof of Concept
```javascript
var ms = require('ms');
var genstr = function (len, chr) {
   var result = "";
   for (i=0; i<=len; i++) {
       result = result + chr;
   }

   return result;
}

ms(genstr(process.argv[2], "5") + " minutea");

```

### Results
Showing increase in execution time based on the input string.
```
$ time node ms.js 10000

real	0m0.758s
user	0m0.724s
sys	0m0.031s

$ time node ms.js 20000

real	0m2.580s
user	0m2.494s
sys	0m0.047s

$ time node ms.js 30000

real	0m5.747s
user	0m5.483s
sys	0m0.080s

$ time node ms.js 80000

real	0m41.022s
user	0m38.894s
sys	0m0.529s
```
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption, CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/04/20/11
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96389
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3fx5-fwvr-xrjg
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nodesecurity.io/advisories/46
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-8315
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K46337613?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K46337613?utm_source=f5support&amp;utm_medium=RSS
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://web.archive.org/web/20200227190911/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96389

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:ms:\<0.7.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2017-20162 (OSSINDEX)  

ms - Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) [CVE-2017-20162]

The software does not properly restrict the size or amount of resources that are requested or influenced by an actor, which can be used to consume more resources than intended.
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:ms:0.7.3:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-w9mr-4mfr-499f (NPM)  

A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, has been found in vercel ms up to 1.x. This issue affects the function parse of the file index.js. The manipulation of the argument str leads to inefficient regular expression complexity. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Upgrading to version 2.0.0 is able to address this issue. The name of the patch is caae2988ba2a37765d055c4eee63d383320ee662. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component. The associated identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-217451.
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w9mr-4mfr-499f
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/vercel/ms/commit/caae2988ba2a37765d055c4eee63d383320ee662
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/vercel/ms/pull/89
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/vercel/ms/releases/tag/2.0.0
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-20162
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://vuldb.com/?ctiid.217451
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://vuldb.com/?id.217451

nconf:0.10.0

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?nconf

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence

Productpackage.jsonnamenconfHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion0.10.0Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/nconf@0.10.0  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-21803 (OSSINDEX)  

This affects the package nconf before 0.11.4. When using the memory engine, it is possible to store a nested JSON representation of the configuration. The .set() function, that is responsible for setting the configuration properties, is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. By providing a crafted property, it is possible to modify the properties on the Object.prototype.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-21803] CWE-1321
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-21803
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/indexzero/nconf/pull/397

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:nconf:0.10.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

netmask:1.0.6

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?netmask

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamenetmaskHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamenetmaskHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion1.0.6Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/netmask@1.0.6  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2021-28918 (OSSINDEX)  

Improper input validation of octal strings in netmask npm package v1.0.6 and below allows unauthenticated remote attackers to perform indeterminate SSRF, RFI, and LFI attacks on many of the dependent packages. A remote unauthenticated attacker can bypass packages relying on netmask to filter IPs and reach critical VPN or LAN hosts.
CWE-704 Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.100000381469727)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2021-28918] CWE-704: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2021-28918
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/rs/node-netmask/pull/35
  • OSSIndex - https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-netmask-networking-bug-impacts-thousands-of-applications/

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:netmask:1.0.6:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-4c7m-wxvm-r7gc (NPM)  

Improper input validation of octal strings in netmask npm package v1.0.6 and below allows unauthenticated remote attackers to perform indeterminate SSRF, RFI, and LFI attacks on many of the dependent packages. A remote unauthenticated attacker can bypass packages relying on netmask to filter IPs and reach critical VPN or LAN hosts.

:exclamation: NOTE: The fix for this issue was incomplete. A subsequent fix was made in version `2.0.1` which was assigned [CVE-2021-29418 / GHSA-pch5-whg9-qr2r](https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pch5-whg9-qr2r). For complete protection from this vulnerability an upgrade to version 2.0.1 or later is recommended.
CWE-20 Improper Input Validation

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.100000381469727)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: critical

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4c7m-wxvm-r7gc
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pch5-whg9-qr2r
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/rs/node-netmask/blob/98294cb20695f2c6c36219a4fbcd4744fb8d0682/CHANGELOG.md#v110-mar-18-2021
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/sickcodes/security/blob/master/advisories/SICK-2021-011.md
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-28918
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://rootdaemon.com/2021/03/29/vulnerability-in-netmask-npm-package-affects-280000-projects/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0010/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-netmask-networking-bug-impacts-thousands-of-applications/
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/package/netmask

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:netmask:\<1.1.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-pch5-whg9-qr2r (NPM)  

The netmask package before 2.0.1 for Node.js mishandles certain unexpected characters in an IP address string, such as an octal digit of 9. This (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass access control that is based on IP addresses. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2021-28918.
CWE-20 Improper Input Validation

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-57cf-349j-352g (NPM)  

Versions of `npmconf` before 2.1.3 allocate and write to disk uninitialized memory contents when a typed number is passed as input on Node.js 4.x.


## Recommendation

Update to version 2.1.3 or later. Consider switching to another config storage mechanism, as npmconf is deprecated and should not be used.
CWE-125 Out-of-bounds Read

Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-57cf-349j-352g

path-to-regexp:0.1.3

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?path-to-regexp

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamepath-to-regexpHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamepath-to-regexpHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion0.1.3Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/path-to-regexp@0.1.3  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2024-45296 (OSSINDEX)  

path-to-regexp turns path strings into a regular expressions. In certain cases, path-to-regexp will output a regular expression that can be exploited to cause poor performance. Because JavaScript is single threaded and regex matching runs on the main thread, poor performance will block the event loop and lead to a DoS. The bad regular expression is generated any time you have two parameters within a single segment, separated by something that is not a period (.). For users of 0.1, upgrade to 0.1.10. All other users should upgrade to 8.0.0.
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv2:
  • Base Score: HIGH (8.699999809265137)
  • Vector: CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N/VC:N/VI:N/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2024-45296] CWE-1333
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2024-45296
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9wv6-86v2-598j

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:path-to-regexp:0.1.3:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-9wv6-86v2-598j (NPM)  

### Impact

A bad regular expression is generated any time you have two parameters within a single segment, separated by something that is not a period (`.`). For example, `/:a-:b`.

### Patches

For users of 0.1, upgrade to `0.1.10`. All other users should upgrade to `8.0.0`.

These versions add backtrack protection when a custom regex pattern is not provided:

- [0.1.10](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v0.1.10)
- [1.9.0](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v1.9.0)
- [3.3.0](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v3.3.0)
- [6.3.0](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v6.3.0)

They do not protect against vulnerable user supplied capture groups. Protecting against explicit user patterns is out of scope for old versions and not considered a vulnerability.

Version [7.1.0](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v7.1.0) can enable `strict: true` and get an error when the regular expression might be bad.

Version [8.0.0](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v8.0.0) removes the features that can cause a ReDoS.

### Workarounds

All versions can be patched by providing a custom regular expression for parameters after the first in a single segment. As long as the custom regular expression does not match the text before the parameter, you will be safe. For example, change `/:a-:b` to `/:a-:b([^-/]+)`.

If paths cannot be rewritten and versions cannot be upgraded, another alternative is to limit the URL length. For example, halving the attack string improves performance by 4x faster.

### Details

Using `/:a-:b` will produce the regular expression `/^\/([^\/]+?)-([^\/]+?)\/?$/`. This can be exploited by a path such as `/a${'-a'.repeat(8_000)}/a`. [OWASP](https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS) has a good example of why this occurs, but the TL;DR is the `/a` at the end ensures this route would never match but due to naive backtracking it will still attempt every combination of the `:a-:b` on the repeated 8,000 `-a`.

Because JavaScript is single threaded and regex matching runs on the main thread, poor performance will block the event loop and can lead to a DoS. In local benchmarks, exploiting the unsafe regex will result in performance that is over 1000x worse than the safe regex. In a more realistic environment using Express v4 and 10 concurrent connections, this translated to average latency of ~600ms vs 1ms.

### References

* [OWASP](https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS)
* [Detailed blog post](https://blakeembrey.com/posts/2024-09-web-redos/)
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9wv6-86v2-598j
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/29b96b4a1de52824e1ca0f49a701183cc4ed476f
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/60f2121e9b66b7b622cc01080df0aabda9eedee6
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/925ac8e3c5780b02f58cbd4e52f95da8ad2ac485
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/d31670ae8f6e69cbfd56e835742195b7d10942ef
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/f1253b47b347dcb909e3e80b0eb2649109e59894
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v6.3.0
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/security/advisories/GHSA-9wv6-86v2-598j
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45296
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20250124-0001

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:path-to-regexp:\<0.1.10:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-rhx6-c78j-4q9w (NPM)  

### Impact

The regular expression that is vulnerable to backtracking can be generated in versions before 0.1.12 of `path-to-regexp`, originally reported in CVE-2024-45296

### Patches

Upgrade to 0.1.12.

### Workarounds

Avoid using two parameters within a single path segment, when the separator is not `.` (e.g. no `/:a-:b`). Alternatively, you can define the regex used for both parameters and ensure they do not overlap to allow backtracking.

### References

- https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9wv6-86v2-598j
- https://blakeembrey.com/posts/2024-09-web-redos/
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://blakeembrey.com/posts/2024-09-web-redos
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rhx6-c78j-4q9w
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/f01c26a013b1889f0c217c643964513acf17f6a4
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/security/advisories/GHSA-rhx6-c78j-4q9w
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-52798
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20250124-0002

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2017-1000048 (OSSINDEX)  

the web framework using ljharb's qs module older than v6.3.2, v6.2.3, v6.1.2, and v6.0.4 is vulnerable to a DoS. A malicious user can send a evil request to cause the web framework crash.

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:qs:2.4.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

CVE-2022-24999 (OSSINDEX)  

qs before 6.10.3, as used in Express before 4.17.3 and other products, allows attackers to cause a Node process hang for an Express application because an __ proto__ key can be used. In many typical Express use cases, an unauthenticated remote attacker can place the attack payload in the query string of the URL that is used to visit the application, such as a[__proto__]=b&a[__proto__]&a[length]=100000000. The fix was backported to qs 6.9.7, 6.8.3, 6.7.3, 6.6.1, 6.5.3, 6.4.1, 6.3.3, and 6.2.4 (and therefore Express 4.17.3, which has "deps: qs@6.9.7" in its release description, is not vulnerable).

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2022-24999 for details
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-24999] CWE-1321
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-24999
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/expressjs/express/releases/tag/4.17.3
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/ljharb/qs/pull/428
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/n8tz/CVE-2022-24999

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:qs:2.4.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-gqgv-6jq5-jjj9 (NPM)  

Affected version of `qs` are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution because it is possible to bypass the protection. The `qs.parse` function fails to properly prevent an object's prototype to be altered when parsing arbitrary input. Input containing `[` or `]` may bypass the prototype pollution protection and alter the Object prototype. This allows attackers to override properties that will exist in all objects, which may lead to Denial of Service or Remote Code Execution in specific circumstances.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to 6.0.4, 6.1.2, 6.2.3, 6.3.2 or later.
CWE-20 Improper Input Validation

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2672

qs before 6.10.3 allows attackers to cause a Node process hang because an `__ proto__` key can be used. In many typical web framework use cases, an unauthenticated remote attacker can place the attack payload in the query string of the URL that is used to visit the application, such as `a[__proto__]=b&a[__proto__]&a[length]=100000000`. The fix was backported to qs 6.9.7, 6.8.3, 6.7.3, 6.6.1, 6.5.3, 6.4.1, 6.3.3, and 6.2.4.

qs:6.5.2

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?qs

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnameqsHigh
Productpackage.jsonnameqsHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion6.5.2Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/qs@6.5.2  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-24999 (OSSINDEX)  

qs before 6.10.3, as used in Express before 4.17.3 and other products, allows attackers to cause a Node process hang for an Express application because an __ proto__ key can be used. In many typical Express use cases, an unauthenticated remote attacker can place the attack payload in the query string of the URL that is used to visit the application, such as a[__proto__]=b&a[__proto__]&a[length]=100000000. The fix was backported to qs 6.9.7, 6.8.3, 6.7.3, 6.6.1, 6.5.3, 6.4.1, 6.3.3, and 6.2.4 (and therefore Express 4.17.3, which has "deps: qs@6.9.7" in its release description, is not vulnerable).

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2022-24999 for details
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-24999] CWE-1321
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-24999
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/expressjs/express/releases/tag/4.17.3
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/ljharb/qs/pull/428
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/n8tz/CVE-2022-24999

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:qs:6.5.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-hrpp-h998-j3pp (NPM)  

qs before 6.10.3 allows attackers to cause a Node process hang because an `__ proto__` key can be used. In many typical web framework use cases, an unauthenticated remote attacker can place the attack payload in the query string of the URL that is used to visit the application, such as `a[__proto__]=b&a[__proto__]&a[length]=100000000`. The fix was backported to qs 6.9.7, 6.8.3, 6.7.3, 6.6.1, 6.5.3, 6.4.1, 6.3.3, and 6.2.4.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hrpp-h998-j3pp

  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20230908-0005

request:2.88.0

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?request

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence

Productpackage.jsonnamerequestHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion2.88.0Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/request@2.88.0  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2023-28155 (OSSINDEX)  

The Request package through 2.88.1 for Node.js allows a bypass of SSRF mitigations via an attacker-controller server that does a cross-protocol redirect (HTTP to HTTPS, or HTTPS to HTTP). NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
CWE-918 Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.099999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2023-28155] CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2023-28155
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p8p7-x288-28g6
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/request/request/issues/3442
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/request/request/pull/3444

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:request:2.88.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-p8p7-x288-28g6 (NPM)  

The `request` package through 2.88.2 for Node.js and the `@cypress/request` package prior to 3.0.0 allow a bypass of SSRF mitigations via an attacker-controller server that does a cross-protocol redirect (HTTP to HTTPS, or HTTPS to HTTP).

NOTE: The `request` package is no longer supported by the maintainer.
CWE-918 Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.099999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://doyensec.com/resources/Doyensec_Advisory_RequestSSRF_Q12023.pdf
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p8p7-x288-28g6
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/cypress-io/request/blob/master/lib/redirect.js#L116
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/cypress-io/request/commit/c5bcf21d40fb61feaff21a0e5a2b3934a440024f
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/cypress-io/request/pull/28
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/cypress-io/request/releases/tag/v3.0.0

  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/request/request/issues/3442
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/request/request/pull/3444
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28155
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20230413-0007

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-25883 (OSSINDEX)  

Versions of the package semver before 7.5.2 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the function new Range, when untrusted user data is provided as a range.



Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2022-25883 for details
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-25883

  • OSSIndex - https://vuldb.com/?id.232060

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:semver:1.1.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-x6fg-f45m-jf5q (NPM)  

Versions 4.3.1 and earlier of `semver` are affected by a regular expression denial of service vulnerability when extremely long version strings are parsed.



## Recommendation

Update to version 4.3.2 or later
CWE-1333 Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

The software does not properly restrict the size or amount of resources that are requested or influenced by an actor, which can be used to consume more resources than intended.

send:0.12.3

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?send

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamesendHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamesendHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion0.12.3Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/send@0.12.3  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-m6fv-jmcg-4jfg (NPM)  

### Impact

passing untrusted user input - even after sanitizing it - to `SendStream.redirect()` may execute untrusted code

### Patches

this issue is patched in send 0.19.0

### Workarounds

users are encouraged to upgrade to the patched version of express, but otherwise can workaround this issue by making sure any untrusted inputs are safe, ideally by validating them against an explicit allowlist

### Details

successful exploitation of this vector requires the following:

1. The attacker MUST control the input to response.redirect()
1. express MUST NOT redirect before the template appears
1. the browser MUST NOT complete redirection before:
1. the user MUST click on the link in the template
CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.0)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: low

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m6fv-jmcg-4jfg
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/send/commit/ae4f2989491b392ae2ef3b0015a019770ae65d35
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/pillarjs/send/security/advisories/GHSA-m6fv-jmcg-4jfg
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43799

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:send:\<0.19.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

CVE-2024-43799 (OSSINDEX)  

Send is a library for streaming files from the file system as a http response. Send passes untrusted user input to SendStream.redirect() which executes untrusted code. This issue is patched in send 0.19.0.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43799 for details
CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (4.699999809265137)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2024-43799] CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2024-43799
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/pillarjs/send/security/advisories/GHSA-m6fv-jmcg-4jfg

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:send:0.12.3:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

serve-static:1.9.3

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?serve-static

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnameserve-staticHigh
Productpackage.jsonnameserve-staticHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion1.9.3Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/serve-static@1.9.3  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-cm22-4g7w-348p (NPM)  

### Impact

passing untrusted user input - even after sanitizing it - to `redirect()` may execute untrusted code

### Patches

this issue is patched in serve-static 1.16.0

### Workarounds

users are encouraged to upgrade to the patched version of express, but otherwise can workaround this issue by making sure any untrusted inputs are safe, ideally by validating them against an explicit allowlist

### Details

successful exploitation of this vector requires the following:

1. The attacker MUST control the input to response.redirect()
1. express MUST NOT redirect before the template appears
1. the browser MUST NOT complete redirection before:
1. the user MUST click on the link in the template
CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.0)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: low

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cm22-4g7w-348p
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/expressjs/serve-static/commit/0c11fad159898cdc69fd9ab63269b72468ecaf6b
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/expressjs/serve-static/commit/ce730896fddce1588111d9ef6fdf20896de5c6fa
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/expressjs/serve-static/security/advisories/GHSA-cm22-4g7w-348p
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43800

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:serve-static:\<1.16.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

set-value:2.0.0

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?set-value

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnameset-valueHigh
Productpackage.jsonnameset-valueHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion2.0.0Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/set-value@2.0.0  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2019-10747 (OSSINDEX)  

set-value is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution in versions lower than 3.0.1. The function mixin-deep could be tricked into adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using any of the constructor, prototype and _proto_ payloads.
CWE-400 Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2019-10747] CWE-400: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption ('Resource Exhaustion')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2019-10747
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/95e9d9923f8a8b4a01da1ea138fcc39ec7b6b15f

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:set-value:2.0.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-4g88-fppr-53pp (NPM)  

Versions of `set-value` prior to 3.0.1 or 2.0.1 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The `set` function fails to validate which Object properties it updates. This allows attackers to modify the prototype of Object, causing the addition or modification of an existing property on all objects.




## Recommendation

If you are using `set-value` 3.x, upgrade to version 3.0.1 or later.
If you are using `set-value` 2.x, upgrade to version 2.0.1 or later.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: critical

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4g88-fppr-53pp

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:set-value:\<2.0.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-4jqc-8m5r-9rpr (NPM)  

This affects the package `set-value`. A type confusion vulnerability can lead to a bypass of CVE-2019-10747 when the user-provided keys used in the path parameter are arrays.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution'), CWE-843 Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')
