shell-quote:1.6.1

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?shell-quote

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnameshell-quoteHigh
Productpackage.jsonnameshell-quoteHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion1.6.1Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/shell-quote@1.6.1  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

GHSA-g4rg-993r-mgx7 (NPM)  

The shell-quote package before 1.7.3 for Node.js allows command injection. An attacker can inject unescaped shell metacharacters through a regex designed to support Windows drive letters. If the output of this package is passed to a real shell as a quoted argument to a command with `exec()`, an attacker can inject arbitrary commands. This is because the Windows drive letter regex character class is `[A-z]` instead of the correct `[A-Za-z]`. Several shell metacharacters exist in the space between capital letter Z and lower case letter a, such as the backtick character.
CWE-77 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: critical

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g4rg-993r-mgx7
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/ljharb/shell-quote/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#173
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/ljharb/shell-quote/commit/5799416ed454aa4ec9afafc895b4e31760ea1abe
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-42740
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/package/shell-quote

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:shell-quote:\<\=1.7.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

snyk-docker-plugin:1.33.1

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?snyk-docker-plugin

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamesnyk-docker-pluginHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamesnyk-docker-pluginHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion1.33.1Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/snyk-docker-plugin@1.33.1  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-22984 (OSSINDEX)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0; the package snyk-mvn-plugin before 2.31.3; the package snyk-gradle-plugin before 3.24.5; the package @snyk/snyk-cocoapods-plugin before 2.5.3; the package snyk-sbt-plugin before 2.16.2; the package snyk-python-plugin before 1.24.2; the package snyk-docker-plugin before 5.6.5; the package @snyk/snyk-hex-plugin before 1.1.6 are vulnerable to Command Injection due to an incomplete fix for [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342). A successful exploit allows attackers to run arbitrary commands on the host system where the Snyk CLI is installed by passing in crafted command line flags. In order to exploit this vulnerability, a user would have to execute the snyk test command on untrusted files. In most cases, an attacker positioned to control the command line arguments to the Snyk CLI would already be positioned to execute arbitrary commands. However, this could be abused in specific scenarios, such as continuous integration pipelines, where developers can control the arguments passed to the Snyk CLI to leverage this component as part of a wider attack against an integration/build pipeline. This issue has been addressed in the latest Snyk Docker images available at https://hub.docker.com/r/snyk/snyk as of 2022-11-29. Images downloaded and built prior to that date should be updated. The issue has also been addressed in the Snyk TeamCity CI/CD plugin as of version v20221130.093605.
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-22984] CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-22984
  • OSSIndex - https://snyk.io/blog/code-injection-vulns-cli-ide-plugins-medium-sev/

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk-docker-plugin:1.33.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-4x6g-3cmx-w76r (NPM)

A successful exploit allows attackers to run arbitrary commands on the host system where the Snyk CLI is installed by passing in crafted command line flags. In order to exploit this vulnerability, a user would have to execute the snyk test command on untrusted files. In most cases, an attacker positioned to control the command line arguments to the Snyk CLI would already be positioned to execute arbitrary commands. However, this could be abused in specific scenarios, such as continuous integration pipelines, where developers can control the arguments passed to the Snyk CLI to leverage this component as part of a wider attack against an integration/build pipeline. This issue has been addressed in the latest Snyk Docker images available at https://hub.docker.com/r/snyk/snyk as of 2022-11-29. Images downloaded and built prior to that date should be updated. snyk-go-plugin:1.11.1

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?snyk-go-plugin

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamesnyk-go-pluginHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamesnyk-go-pluginHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion1.11.1Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/snyk-go-plugin@1.11.1  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-40764 (OSSINDEX)  

Snyk CLI before 1.996.0 allows arbitrary command execution, affecting Snyk IDE plugins and the snyk npm package. Exploitation could follow from the common practice of viewing untrusted files in the Visual Studio Code editor, for example. The original demonstration was with shell metacharacters in the vendor.json ignore field, affecting snyk-go-plugin before 1.19.1. This affects, for example, the Snyk TeamCity plugin (which does not update automatically) before 20220930.142957.
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-40764] CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-40764
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-go-plugin/pull/99
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-go-plugin/releases/tag/v1.19.1
  • OSSIndex - https://jmolindonesia.com/how-scanning-your-projects-for-security-issues-can-lead-to-remote-code-execution/

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk-go-plugin:1.11.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2024-48964 (OSSINDEX)  

The package Snyk CLI before 1.1294.0 is vulnerable to Code Injection when scanning an untrusted Gradle project. The vulnerability can be triggered if Snyk test is run inside the untrusted project due to the improper handling of the current working directory name. Snyk recommends only scanning trusted projects.
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (8.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk-gradle-plugin:3.2.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

The Snyk gradle plugin is vulnerable to Code Injection when scanning an untrusted Gradle project. The vulnerability can be triggered if Snyk test is run inside the untrusted project due to the improper handling of the current working directory name. Snyk recommends only scanning trusted projects.

CVE-2022-22984 (OSSINDEX)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0; the package snyk-mvn-plugin before 2.31.3; the package snyk-gradle-plugin before 3.24.5; the package @snyk/snyk-cocoapods-plugin before 2.5.3; the package snyk-sbt-plugin before 2.16.2; the package snyk-python-plugin before 1.24.2; the package snyk-docker-plugin before 5.6.5; the package @snyk/snyk-hex-plugin before 1.1.6 are vulnerable to Command Injection due to an incomplete fix for [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342). A successful exploit allows attackers to run arbitrary commands on the host system where the Snyk CLI is installed by passing in crafted command line flags. In order to exploit this vulnerability, a user would have to execute the snyk test command on untrusted files. In most cases, an attacker positioned to control the command line arguments to the Snyk CLI would already be positioned to execute arbitrary commands. However, this could be abused in specific scenarios, such as continuous integration pipelines, where developers can control the arguments passed to the Snyk CLI to leverage this component as part of a wider attack against an integration/build pipeline. Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk-gradle-plugin:3.2.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-4x6g-3cmx-w76r (NPM)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0; the package snyk-mvn-plugin before 2.31.3; the package snyk-gradle-plugin before 3.24.5; the package @snyk/snyk-cocoapods-plugin before 2.5.3; the package snyk-sbt-plugin before 2.16.2; the package snyk-python-plugin before 1.24.2; the package snyk-docker-plugin before 5.6.5; the package @snyk/snyk-hex-plugin before 1.1.6 are vulnerable to Command Injection due to an incomplete fix for [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342). A successful exploit allows attackers to run arbitrary commands on the host system where the Snyk CLI is installed by passing in crafted command line flags. In order to exploit this vulnerability, a user would have to execute the snyk test command on untrusted files. In most cases, an attacker positioned to control the command line arguments to the Snyk CLI would already be positioned to execute arbitrary commands. However, this could be abused in specific scenarios, such as continuous integration pipelines, where developers can control the arguments passed to the Snyk CLI to leverage this component as part of a wider attack against an integration/build pipeline. This issue has been addressed in the latest Snyk Docker images available at https://hub.docker.com/r/snyk/snyk as of 2022-11-29. Images downloaded and built prior to that date should be updated. The issue has also been addressed in the Snyk TeamCity CI/CD plugin as of version v20221130.093605.
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4x6g-3cmx-w76r
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/cli/commit/80d97a93326406e09776156daf72e3caa03ae25a
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-cocoapods-plugin/commit/c73e049c5200772babde61c40aab57296bf91381
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-docker-plugin/commit/d730d7630691a61587b120bb11daaaf4b58a8357
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-gradle-plugin/commit/bb1c1c72a75e97723a76b14d2d73f70744ed5009
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-hex-plugin/commit/e8dd2a330b40d7fc0ab47e34413e80a0146d7ac3
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-mvn-plugin/commit/02cda9ba1ea36b00ead3f6ec2de0f97397ebec50
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-python-plugin/commit/8591abdd9236108ac3e30c70c09238d6bb6aabf4
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-sbt-plugin/commit/99c09eb12c9f8f2b237aea9627aab1ae3cab6437
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-22984
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3038622
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYKDOCKERPLUGIN-3039679
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYKGRADLEPLUGIN-3038624
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYKMVNPLUGIN-3038623
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYKPYTHONPLUGIN-3039677
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYKSBTPLUGIN-3038626
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYKSNYKCOCOAPODSPLUGIN-3038625
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYKSNYKHEXPLUGIN-3039680
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.imperva.com/blog/how-scanning-your-projects-for-security-issues-can-lead-to-remote-code-execution/

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk-gradle-plugin:\<3.24.5:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

snyk-mvn-plugin:2.7.0

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?snyk-mvn-plugin

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamesnyk-mvn-pluginHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamesnyk-mvn-pluginHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion2.7.0Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/snyk-mvn-plugin@2.7.0  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-22984 (OSSINDEX)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0; the package snyk-mvn-plugin before 2.31.3; the package snyk-gradle-plugin before 3.24.5; the package @snyk/snyk-cocoapods-plugin before 2.5.3; the package snyk-sbt-plugin before 2.16.2; the package snyk-python-plugin before 1.24.2; the package snyk-docker-plugin before 5.6.5; the package @snyk/snyk-hex-plugin before 1.1.6 are vulnerable to Command Injection due to an incomplete fix for [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342). A successful exploit allows attackers to run arbitrary commands on the host system where the Snyk CLI is installed by passing in crafted command line flags. In order to exploit this vulnerability, a user would have to execute the snyk test command on untrusted files. In most cases, an attacker positioned to control the command line arguments to the Snyk CLI would already be positioned to execute arbitrary commands. However, this could be abused in specific scenarios, such as continuous integration pipelines, where developers can control the arguments passed to the Snyk CLI to leverage this component as part of a wider attack against an integration/build pipeline. This issue has been addressed in the latest Snyk Docker images available at https://hub.docker.com/r/snyk/snyk as of 2022-11-29. Images downloaded and built prior to that date should be updated. The issue has also been addressed in the Snyk TeamCity CI/CD plugin as of version v20221130.093605.
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-22984] CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-22984
  • OSSIndex - https://snyk.io/blog/code-injection-vulns-cli-ide-plugins-medium-sev/

Versionpackage.jsonversion1.7.0Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/snyk-php-plugin@1.7.0  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2024-48963 (OSSINDEX)  

The package Snyk CLI before 1.1294.0 is vulnerable to Code Injection when scanning an untrusted PHP project. The vulnerability can be triggered if Snyk test is run inside the untrusted project due to the improper handling of the current working directory name. Snyk recommends only scanning trusted projects.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2024-48963 for details
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2024-48963] CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2024-48963
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-69f9-h8f9-7vjf

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk-php-plugin:1.7.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-69f9-h8f9-7vjf (NPM)  

The Snyk php plugin is vulnerable to Code Injection when scanning an untrusted PHP project. The vulnerability can be triggered if Snyk test is run inside the untrusted project due to the improper handling of the current working directory name. Snyk recommends only scanning trusted projects.
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-22984 (OSSINDEX)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0; the package snyk-mvn-plugin before 2.31.3; the package snyk-gradle-plugin before 3.24.5; the package @snyk/snyk-cocoapods-plugin before 2.5.3; the package snyk-sbt-plugin before 2.16.2; the package snyk-python-plugin before 1.24.2; the package snyk-docker-plugin before 5.6.5; the package @snyk/snyk-hex-plugin before 1.1.6 are vulnerable to Command Injection due to an incomplete fix for [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342). A successful exploit allows attackers to run arbitrary commands on the host system where the Snyk CLI is installed by passing in crafted command line flags. In order to exploit this vulnerability, a user would have to execute the snyk test command on untrusted files. In most cases, an attacker positioned to control the command line arguments to the Snyk CLI would already be positioned to execute arbitrary commands. However, this could be abused in specific scenarios, such as continuous integration pipelines, where developers can control the arguments passed to the Snyk CLI to leverage this component as part of a wider attack against an integration/build pipeline. This issue has been addressed in the latest Snyk Docker images available at https://hub.docker.com/r/snyk/snyk as of 2022-11-29. Images downloaded and built prior to that date should be updated. The issue has also been addressed in the Snyk TeamCity CI/CD plugin as of version v20221130.093605.

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-22984 (OSSINDEX)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0; the package snyk-mvn-plugin before 2.31.3; the package snyk-gradle-plugin before 3.24.5; the package @snyk/snyk-cocoapods-plugin before 2.5.3; the package snyk-sbt-plugin before 2.16.2; the package snyk-python-plugin before 1.24.2; the package snyk-docker-plugin before 5.6.5; the package @snyk/snyk-hex-plugin before 1.1.6 are vulnerable to Command Injection due to an incomplete fix for [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342).   • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk-sbt-plugin:2.11.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-4x6g-3cmx-w76r (NPM)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0; the package snyk-mvn-plugin before 2.31.3; the package snyk-gradle-plugin before 3.24.5; the package @snyk/snyk-cocoapods-plugin before 2.5.3; the package snyk-sbt-plugin before 2.16.2; the package snyk-python-plugin before 1.24.2; the package snyk-docker-plugin before 5.6.5; the package @snyk/snyk-hex-plugin before 1.1.6 are vulnerable to Command Injection due to an incomplete fix for [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342). A successful exploit allows attackers to run arbitrary commands on the host system where the Snyk CLI is installed by passing in crafted command line flags. In order to exploit this vulnerability, a user would have to execute the snyk test command on untrusted files. In most cases, an attacker positioned to control the command line arguments to the Snyk CLI would already be positioned to execute arbitrary commands. However, this could be abused in specific scenarios, such as continuous integration pipelines, where developers can control the arguments passed to the Snyk CLI to leverage this component as part of a wider attack against an integration/build pipeline. This issue has been addressed in the latest Snyk Docker images available at https://hub.docker.com/r/snyk/snyk as of 2022-11-29. Images downloaded and built prior to that date should be updated. The issue has also been addressed in the Snyk TeamCity CI/CD plugin as of version v20221130.093605.
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4x6g-3cmx-w76r

  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-docker-plugin/commit/d730d7630691a61587b120bb11daaaf4b58a8357
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-gradle-plugin/commit/bb1c1c72a75e97723a76b14d2d73f70744ed5009
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-hex-plugin/commit/e8dd2a330b40d7fc0ab47e34413e80a0146d7ac3

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk-sbt-plugin:\<2.16.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

snyk:1.278.1

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?snyk

Referenced In Project/Scope: package-lock.json: transitive

Evidence

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnamesnykHigh
Productpackage.jsonnamesnykHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion1.278.1Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/snyk@1.278.1  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2022-24441 (OSSINDEX)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0 are vulnerable to Code Injection when analyzing a project. An attacker who can convince a user to scan a malicious project can include commands in a build file such as build.gradle or gradle-wrapper.jar, which will be executed with the privileges of the application. This vulnerability may be triggered when running the the CLI tool directly, or when running a scan with one of the IDE plugins that invoke the Snyk CLI. Successful exploitation of this issue would likely require some level of social engineering - to coerce an untrusted project to be downloaded and analyzed via the Snyk CLI or opened in an IDE where a Snyk IDE plugin is installed and enabled. Additionally, if the IDE has a Trust feature then the target folder must be marked as ‘trusted’ in order to be vulnerable. **NOTE:** This issue is independent of the one reported in [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342), and upgrading to a fixed version for this addresses that issue as well. The affected IDE plugins and versions are: - VS Code - Affected: <=1.8.0, Fixed: 1.9.0 - IntelliJ - Affected: <=2.4.47, Fixed: 2.4.48 - Visual Studio - Affected: <=1.1.30, Fixed: 1.1.31 - Eclipse - Affected: <=v20221115.132308, Fixed: All subsequent versions - Language Server - Affected: <=v20221109.114426, Fixed: All subsequent versions
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (8.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-24441] CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-24441
  • OSSIndex - https://snyk.io/blog/code-injection-vulns-cli-ide-plugins-medium-sev/

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk:1.278.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-4vrv-93c7-m92j (NPM)  

The package snyk before 1.1064.0 is vulnerable to Code Injection when analyzing a project. An attacker who can convince a user to scan a malicious project can include commands in a build file such as build.gradle or gradle-wrapper.jar, which will be executed with the privileges of the application. This vulnerability may be triggered when running the the CLI tool directly, or when running a scan with one of the IDE plugins that invoke the Snyk CLI. Successful exploitation of this issue would likely require some level of social engineering - to coerce an untrusted project to be downloaded and analyzed via the Snyk CLI or opened in an IDE where a Snyk IDE plugin is installed and enabled. Additionally, if the IDE has a Trust feature then the target folder must be marked as ‘trusted’ in order to be vulnerable.

**NOTE:** This issue is independent of the one reported in [CVE-2022-40764](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3037342), and upgrading to a fixed version for this addresses that issue as well.

The affected IDE plugins and versions are: 
- VS Code - Affected: <=1.8.0, Fixed: 1.9.0 
- IntelliJ - Affected: <=2.4.47, Fixed: 2.4.48 
- Visual Studio - Affected: <=1.1.30, Fixed: 1.1.31 
- Eclipse - Affected: <=v20221115.132308, Fixed: All subsequent versions 
- Language Server - Affected: <=v20221109.114426, Fixed: All subsequent versions
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection'), CWE-94 Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (8.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4vrv-93c7-m92j
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-eclipse-plugin/commit/b5a8bce25a359ced75f83a729fc6b2393fc9a495
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-intellij-plugin/commit/56682f4ba6081ce1d95cb980cbfacd3809a826f4
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-ls/commit/b3229f0142f782871aa72d1a7dcf417546d568ed
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-visual-studio-plugin/commit/0b53dbbd4a3153c3ef9aaf797af3b5caad0f731a
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/vscode-extension/commit/0db3b4240be0db6a0a5c6d02c0d4231a2c4ba708
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-24441
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-SNYK-3111871
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.imperva.com/blog/how-scanning-your-projects-for-security-issues-can-lead-to-remote-code-execution

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:snyk:\<1.1064.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-hpqj-7cj6-hfj8 (NPM)  

Snyk CLI before 1.996.0 allows arbitrary command execution, affecting Snyk IDE plugins and the snyk npm package. Exploitation could follow from the common practice of viewing untrusted files in the Visual Studio Code editor, for example. The original demonstration was with shell metacharacters in the vendor.json ignore field, affecting snyk-go-plugin before 1.19.1. This affects, for example, the Snyk TeamCity plugin (which does not update automatically) before 20220930.142957.
CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hpqj-7cj6-hfj8
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/cli/releases/tag/v1.996.0
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/snyk/snyk-go-plugin/releases/tag/v1.19.1

  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.imperva.com/blog/how-scanning-your-projects-for-security-issues-can-lead-to-remote-code-execution/

st:0.2.4

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?st

Productpackage.jsonnamestHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion0.2.4Highest

Identifiers

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2014-3744 (OSSINDEX)  

Directory traversal vulnerability in the st module before 0.2.5 for Node.js allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a %2e%2e (encoded dot dot) in an unspecified path.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2014-3744 for details
CWE-22 Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2014-3744] CWE-22: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2014-3744
  • OSSIndex - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/36

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:st:0.2.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-69rr-wvh9-6c4q (NPM)  

Versions of `st` prior to 0.2.5 are affected by a directory traversal vulnerability. Vulnerable versions fail to properly handle URL encoded dots, which caused `%2e` to be interpreted as `.` by the filesystem, resulting the potential for an attacker to read sensitive files on the server.


## Recommendation

Update to version 0.2.5 or later.
CWE-22 Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/05/13/1
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/05/15/2
  • NPM Advisory reference: - http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/67389
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-69rr-wvh9-6c4q
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/isaacs/st
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/isaacs/st#security-status
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-3744
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/36

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:st:\<0.2.5:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

CVE-2017-16224 (OSSINDEX)  

st - Open Redirect [CVE-2017-16224]

A web application accepts a user-controlled input that specifies a link to an external site, and uses that link in a Redirect. This simplifies phishing attacks.
CWE-601 URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.099999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2017-16224] CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
  • OSSIndex - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/547

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:st:0.2.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-72fg-jqhx-c68p (NPM)  

st is a module for serving static files.

An attacker is able to craft a request that results in an `HTTP 301` (redirect) to an entirely different domain. 

A request for: `http://some.server.com//nodesecurity.org/%2e%2e` would result in a 301 to `//nodesecurity.org/%2e%2e` which most browsers treat as a proper redirect as `//` is translated into the current schema being used.

**Mitigating factor:** 

In order for this to work, `st` must be serving from the root of a server (`/`) rather than the typical sub directory (`/static/`) and the redirect URL will end with some form of URL encoded `..` ("%2e%2e", "%2e.", ".%2e"). 

Code example (provided by Xin Gao): 

[example.js]

```js
var st = require('st') 
var http = require('http') 
http.createServer(st(process.cwd())).listen(1337)
```

```shell
$ curl -v http://localhost:1337//cve.mitre.com/%2e%2e
*   Trying ::1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to localhost (::1) port 1337 (#0)
> GET //cve.mitre.com/%2e%2e HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:1337
> User-Agent: curl/7.54.0
> Accept: */*
>
< HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently
< cache-control: public, max-age=600
< last-modified: Fri, 13 Oct 2017 22:56:33 GMT
< etag: "16777220-46488904-1507935393000"
< location: //cve.mitre.com/%2e%2e/
< Date: Fri, 13 Oct 2017 22:56:41 GMT
< Connection: keep-alive
< Content-Length: 30
<
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact
```


## Recommendation

Update to version 1.2.2 or later.
CWE-601 URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.099999904632568)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-72fg-jqhx-c68p
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-16224
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/547

Vulnerable Software & Versions (NPM):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:st:\<\=1.2.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

tough-cookie:2.4.3

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?tough-cookie

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2023-26136 (OSSINDEX)  

Versions of the package tough-cookie before 4.1.3 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution due to improper handling of Cookies when using CookieJar in rejectPublicSuffixes=false mode. This issue arises from the manner in which the objects are initialized.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2023-26136] CWE-1321

  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/releases/tag/v4.1.3

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:tough-cookie:2.4.3:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-72xf-g2v4-qvf3 (NPM)  

Versions of the package tough-cookie before 4.1.3 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution due to improper handling of Cookies when using CookieJar in `rejectPublicSuffixes=false` mode. This issue arises from the manner in which the objects are initialized.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (6.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-72xf-g2v4-qvf3

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2020-8158 (OSSINDEX)  

Prototype pollution vulnerability in the TypeORM package < 0.2.25 may allow attackers to add or modify Object properties leading to further denial of service or SQL injection attacks.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2020-8158] CWE-1321 CWE-471
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2020-8158
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/pull/6096
  • OSSIndex - https://hackerone.com/reports/869574

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:typeorm:0.2.24:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

CVE-2022-33171 (OSSINDEX)  

The findOne function in TypeORM before 0.3.0 can either be supplied with a string or a FindOneOptions object. When input to the function is a user-controlled parsed JSON object, supplying a crafted FindOneOptions instead of an id string leads to SQL injection. NOTE: the vendor's position is that the user's application is responsible for input validation

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2022-33171 for details
CWE-89 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: CRITICAL (9.800000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2022-33171] CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2022-33171
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/pull/8616
  • OSSIndex - https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2022/Jun/51

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:typeorm:0.2.24:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-cf4h-3jhx-xvhq (NPM)  

The package `underscore` from 1.13.0-0 and before 1.13.0-2, from 1.3.2 and before 1.12.1 are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution via the template function, particularly when a variable property is passed as an argument as it is not sanitized.

### Impact
Versions of `validator` prior to 13.7.0 are affected by an inefficient Regular Expression complexity  when using the `rtrim` and `trim` sanitizers.

The problem has been patched in validator 13.7.0

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2023-0842 (OSSINDEX)  

xml2js version 0.4.23 allows an external attacker to edit or add new properties to an object. This is possible because the application does not properly validate incoming JSON keys, thus allowing the __proto__ property to be edited.

Sonatype's research suggests that this CVE's details differ from those defined at NVD. See https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2023-0842 for details
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:y18n:3.2.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-c4w7-xm78-47vh (NPM)  

### Overview

The npm package `y18n` before versions 3.2.2, 4.0.1, and 5.0.5 is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. 

### POC

```js
const y18n = require('y18n')();

y18n.setLocale('__proto__');
y18n.updateLocale({polluted: true});

console.log(polluted); // true
```

### Recommendation

Upgrade to version 3.2.2, 4.0.1, 5.0.5 or later.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution'), CWE-20 Improper Input Validation, CWE-915 Improperly Controlled Modification of Dynamically-Determined Object Attributes

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c4w7-xm78-47vh
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/y18n/commit/90401eea9062ad498f4f792e3fff8008c4c193a3
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/y18n/commit/a9ac604abf756dec9687be3843e2c93bfe581f25
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/y18n/issues/96
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/y18n/pull/108
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-7774

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2020-7774 (OSSINDEX)  

y18n - Prototype Pollution [ CVE-2020-7774 ]

The software does not properly protect an assumed-immutable element from being modified by an attacker.
CWE-471 Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data (MAID)

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.5)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N

  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2020-7774] CWE-471: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data (MAID)

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:y18n:4.0.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-c4w7-xm78-47vh (NPM)  

### Overview

The npm package `y18n` before versions 3.2.2, 4.0.1, and 5.0.5 is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. 

### POC

```js
const y18n = require('y18n')();

y18n.setLocale('__proto__');
y18n.updateLocale({polluted: true});

console.log(polluted); // true
```

### Recommendation

Upgrade to version 3.2.2, 4.0.1, 5.0.5 or later.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution'), CWE-20 Improper Input Validation, CWE-915 Improperly Controlled Modification of Dynamically-Determined Object Attributes

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: HIGH (7.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: high

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c4w7-xm78-47vh
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/y18n/commit/90401eea9062ad498f4f792e3fff8008c4c193a3
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/y18n/commit/a9ac604abf756dec9687be3843e2c93bfe581f25
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/y18n/issues/96
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/y18n/pull/108
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-7774
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGWEBJARSNPM-1038306
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-Y18N-1021887
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuApr2021.html

yargs-parser:9.0.2

File Path: C:\enigma\nodejs-goof\package-lock.json?yargs-parser

TypeSourceNameValueConfidence
Vendorpackage.jsonnameyargs-parserHigh
Productpackage.jsonnameyargs-parserHighest
Versionpackage.jsonversion9.0.2Highest

Identifiers

  • pkg:npm/yargs-parser@9.0.2  (Confidence:Highest)

Published Vulnerabilities

CVE-2020-7608 (OSSINDEX)  

yargs-parser could be tricked into adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using a "__proto__" payload.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L

References:
  • OSSINDEX - [CVE-2020-7608] CWE-1321
  • OSSIndex - http://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2020-7608
  • OSSIndex - https://github.com/yargs/yargs-parser/pull/258

Vulnerable Software & Versions (OSSINDEX):

  • cpe:2.3:a:*:yargs-parser:9.0.2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

GHSA-p9pc-299p-vxgp (NPM)  

Affected versions of `yargs-parser` are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of `Object`, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.  
Parsing the argument `--foo.__proto__.bar baz'` adds a `bar` property with value `baz` to all objects. This is only exploitable if attackers have control over the arguments being passed to `yargs-parser`.



## Recommendation

Upgrade to versions 13.1.2, 15.0.1, 18.1.1 or later.
CWE-1321 Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution'), CWE-915 Improperly Controlled Modification of Dynamically-Determined Object Attributes

CVSSv3:
  • Base Score: MEDIUM (5.300000190734863)
  • Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L
Unscored:
  • Severity: moderate

References:
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p9pc-299p-vxgp
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/yargs-parser/commit/1c417bd0b42b09c475ee881e36d292af4fa2cc36
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://github.com/yargs/yargs-parser/commit/63810ca1ae1a24b08293a4d971e70e058c7a41e2
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-7608
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-YARGSPARSER-560381
  • NPM Advisory reference: - https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/1500
